edits.corrected_text: A late, dull autumn night was closing in upon the river Saone.
edits.notes: Added 'A' at the beginning of the sentence
edits.original_text: late, dull autumn night was closing in upon the river Saone.

edits.corrected_text: like a sullied looking-glass in a gloomy place, reflected
edits.notes: Added 'like' at the beginning of the phrase
edits.original_text: a sullied looking-glass in a gloomy place, reflected

edits.corrected_text: heavy streak, occasionally made a little ragged by a row of poplar trees
edits.original_text: heavy streak, occasionally made a little ragged by a row of trees

edits.corrected_text: One man, slowly moving on towards Chalons, was the only visible
edits.original_text: One man slowly moving on towards Chalons was the only visible

and his shoes and gaiters trodden out, his hair and beard untrimmed; the cloak he carried over his shoulder, and the clothes he wore, sodden with wet; limping along in pain and difficulty; he looked as if the clouds were hurrying from him, as if the wail of the wind and the shuddering of the grass

edits.corrected_text: the low mysterious plashing of the water murmured at him, as if the fitful autumn night were disturbed by him.
edits.notes: Rephrased or added to the sentence for clarity
edits.original_text: the low mysterious plashing of the water murmured at him, as if the fitful autumn night were disturbed by him.
